text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm gonna show
you how to make my pasta with broccoli
and this is a dish I ate growing up so
very very often because I mean I love
broccoli and this is one of my favorite
ways to eat them so it's simple its
quick its inexpensive and let me take
you over the ingredients so you can get
started you're gonna need some pasta of
your choice and I'm choosing to use the
shortcut rigatoni but you can use any
pasta you'd like you're gonna need some
fresh block broccoli florets just like
this cut into small pieces you need a
pinch of hot pepper flakes but that's
optional some chicken stock some fresh
garlic a little bit of butter
cumin generated Jonel salt pepper and
olive oil so easy easy easy and you can
use whatever vegetable you want really
but I love to use this with broccoli so
first thing you wanna do is get a pan
fill it with water bring it up to a boil
and put on a generous sprinkling of salt
that's gonna be for the pasta the second
thing you want to do is take a skillet
like so with a couple tablespoons of
olive oil and I have this over medium
heat to this I'm going to add in my
sliced garlic and it's not sizzling yet
because I want to infuse that oil with
the garlic so I'm heating it up together
so let that cook for a couple of minutes
or until the garlic becomes really
really fragrant that looks good and
adding a pinch of hot pepper flakes and
this is completely up to you add up to
how hot you like it if you like your
really spicy then add in a little bit
more but that's good enough for me so
now to that I'm going to add in my fresh
broccoli and it's really important that

now looks awesome okay now to this I'm

there you go
now what I'm gonna do is I'm gonna let
this cook for about seven to eight

really tender and now this is the

in your pasta to your boiling water my
broccoli has been cooking for about

to do next
taking a wooden spoon I want you to kind

because this kind of makes the sauce
thicken with the sauce and it makes the

so I'm just doing it not again you don't

before it's not is looking pretty good
so now I'm gonna go drain the pasta and
then we'll finish the whole thing off
now I drain my pasta know what I'm gonna
do is I'm gonna crank the heat up to
high and what I've done is I've reserved
a little bit of the starchy cooking

little bit of it to my broccoli only
because it's gonna help thicken the
sauce it's gonna pull it together really
really nicely now I'm gonna just add in

bit richer and creamier and then I'm

parmigiano-reggiano and you don't need

this is kind of what makes the sauce
creamy what brings it together and gives

you can always put a little extra on
